intro: Camellia fangchengensis, commonly known as the Fangchengensis camellia, is a rare evergreen shrub native to southern China. It belongs to the Theaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, camellia-like flowers. The plant produces large, cup-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun. Due to its limited distribution and ornamental value, it is considered a valuable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
